value.title: From autonomous cars to autonomous weapons, the AI ethics issues can't be ignored
value.excerpt: Autonomous technology is racing towards us. But whether its autonomous cars or autonomous weapons, there are serious questions. This is where AI ethics comes to a head.

value.title: Massaging AI language models for fun, profit and ethics

value.title: Why it's time to address the ethical dilemmas of artificial intelligence

value.title: AI Visionary, Leader And 21st Century Maverick Sol Rashidi Of Estée Lauder
value.excerpt: My Conversation with one of the most influential, inspirational and brilliant minds. As part of my Series of The 9 Inspirational Women Leaders In AI Shaping The 21st Century, I was honored to converse with Sol Rashidi.

value.title: NSW government AI projects face ethics assessment under new assurance framework
value.excerpt: The mandated AI Assurance Framework will help agencies establish clear governance and accountability measures when using AI.

value.title: Crafting Ethical AI That Monitors Unethical AI And Tries To Deter Bad AI From Acting Up, Useful Even For Exalted AI-Based Self-Driving Cars
value.excerpt: Let's use Ethical AI to oversee unethical AI, though this can be tricky and care is needed, which is illustrated via examples in the advent of AI-based self-driving cars.

value.title: AI Weekly: Nvidia’s commitment to voice AI — and a farewell
value.excerpt: GTC conference, Nvidia redoubled its commitment to voice AI. In other news, reporter Kyle Wiggers announces he's leaving VentureBeat.

value.title: Banks Using AI Are Ripe for Russian Sabotage: Report
value.excerpt: Experts worry machine learning's reliance on large data sets to train make them particularly vulnerable to data manipulation attacks.

value.title: AI Experts Warn of Potential Cyberwar Facing Banking Sector
value.excerpt: U.S. authorities have flagged the U.S. financial system, a central pillar in the U.S. sanctions regime, as an attractive target, and officials and security experts have warned for weeks about the possibility of retaliatory cyberattacks from Russia.

value.title: Explainable AI: from black box to transparency
value.excerpt: Financial organizations and their customers need to learn more about how AI works, citing the “black box” of AI as a complete mystery. They don’t understand how decisions are reached or for what reasons.

value.title: AI Robots for the Elderly Mean Well, but Raise Ethical Issues
value.excerpt: AI robots are increasingly being used to supplement care for the elderly, but experts warn they'll never replace human companionship.

value.title: Ethical AI Ambitiously Hoping To Have AI Learn Ethical Behavior By Itself, Such As The Case With AI In Autonomous Self-Driving Cars
value.excerpt: Maybe AI can learn to be ethical, though this is harder than it seems, including considerations underlying AI-based self-driving cars.

value.title: Trueface, Clarifai join Data Ethics Consortium for Security
value.excerpt: DECS is an organization focusing on aiding developers and policymakers to ensure artificial intelligence and machine learning tools are deployed safely.

value.title: Designing AI Ethics, in Practice and in Public
value.excerpt: Just as the design of user experience for AI and its related technologies are vital concerns for architects and designers, so too are questions about ethics and AI. value.title: AI Ethics Keeps Relentlessly Asking Or Imploring How To Adequately Control AI, Including The Matter Of AI That Drives Self-Driving Cars
value.excerpt: The AI Control Problem is what keeps AI ethics up at night, for which paths to solving the pressing issue are discussed, along with examples from AI-based self-driving cars.

value.title: Artificial intelligence is everywhere now. This report shows how we got here.
value.excerpt: Stanford's new report reveals what artificial intelligence is capable of these days, and how widely used it is.

value.title: Stanford report shows that ethics challenges continue to dog AI field as funding climbs
value.excerpt: A report from Stanford's Human-Centered AI institute shows that AI remains dogged by ethical and bias challenges, but that funding is increasing.

value.title: Despite AI race hype, US and China make a formidable AI tag team
value.excerpt: With all the talk about competition between the U.S. and China to dominate AI advancement, it turns out researchers in both countries work together. A lot.

value.title: AI Ethics And The Riddle Underlying Criminal Accountability Of AI, Including Crimes Committed By Revered AI-Based Self-Driving Cars
value.excerpt: Ethical AI is contending with whether or not AI ought to be criminally accountable, which can be illustrated via crimes potentially committed via AI self-driving cars.
